metadata.synopsis: A weary gravekeeper, absolutely exhausted at having to bury so many bodies in recent days. Would be good to have her have typical gallows humour, but be relatively kindhearted and helpful underneath it (though relatively unimportant) She will exclusively hang around the gravekeeper's house, and likely either be found sat and resting or just idly milling around a small area.Important topics:- Where you can find a shovel- Killings in Baldur's Gate (with a branch for if it's solved)- (When you've encountered them) Kobold Looters- Something to chastise the player if they've gone around digging up graves themselves, probably a HasMet alt?
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to the Gravekeeper in the House in the Lower City graveyard.

19.speaker: Valmorba
19.text: I am sorry for your loss, but it will be a tenday before I can take your departed. Maybe more.

76.speaker: Valmorba
76.text: If you notice any odours before then, treat the body with jasmine, honeysuckle - whatever you can get.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Pah, there usually isn't much left once I'm done with a body.

67.speaker: Valmorba
67.text: Think I'm not used to deviants like you in my graveyard? You aren't special, you know.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: My dear, precious sister perished recently! Is there nothing that can be done?

26.speaker: Valmorba
26.text: I don't have a plot left to sell you, yet alone the time to schedule a burial.

23.speaker: Valmorba
23.text: I hope you have other family to provide you some comfort as you mourn.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'm looking for a grave. Name of M Kurwin?

61.speaker: Valmorba
61.text: Kurwin? Oh, yes - he's just outside, under the great willow with the drooping branches.

56.speaker: Valmorba
56.text: It's good of you to come. He hasn't had any visitors in a long time.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Just want to pay my respects.

0.speaker: Valmorba
0.text: It's important to remember those who have gone before us. I wish there were more like you.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Great! Now, do you have a shovel I can borrow?

30.speaker: Valmorba
30.text: A shovel? Tell me you're joking.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: I'm not joking and I'm done asking. Give me a shovel.

41.speaker: Valmorba
41.text: There - there's one by the grand mausoleum. Down the steps, past the fountain.

13.speaker: Valmorba
13.text: You think you can scare me? You think there is anything I have not seen?
13.context: NodeContext: Amused that the player thinks they can intimidate you

34.speaker: Valmorba
34.text: This is a house of peace and respect - you are interested in neither. Get out.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: I need it to tidy up some of the older graves. I hate to see them neglected.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I might need to tidy up Kurwin's grave. You said it hadn't been cared for.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: The kobolds made a real mess out there. I'd like to help clean it up.

48.speaker: Valmorba
48.text: That's... very kind, actually. Thank you.

5.speaker: Valmorba
5.text: If you go down all the steps, past the fountain, you'll find the grand mausoleum. There should be one there.
5.context: InternalNodeContext: Points the player towards the fancy part of the graveyard, with the overly large gold/grey roofed mausoleum near the extravagent statue and the small pond feature

21.speaker: Valmorba
21.text: I have no time for this - get out before I call the Watch!

44.speaker: Valmorba
44.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at the player, responding to them saying "I'll just go"

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I hear there's a serial killer out there. No wonder you're busy.

66.speaker: Valmorba
66.text: Yes and no. The murders were terrible, but all causes of death are on the rise.

7.speaker: Valmorba
7.text: More killed in bar fights, more killed at home, more attacks on strangers.

28.speaker: Valmorba
28.text: Fear is taking more lives than any cult. Everyone is on edge, watching each other, and ready to draw steel.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: It sounds like you're pretty busy.

36.speaker: Valmorba
36.text: Well, there is a serial killer on the loose. Business is booming, unfortunately.

71.speaker: Valmorba
71.text: Can't say. There are a hundred theories, but I see no pattern in who comes through my door.

8.speaker: Valmorba
8.text: Mind you, fear is taking more lives than any one killer. The whole city is on edge, ready to draw steel.

35.speaker: Valmorba
35.text: I only hope the worst is behind us now that this killer has been dealt with.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Did you know there were kobolds looting your graves?

45.speaker: Valmorba
45.text: I saw. I saw their bodies, too. Your doing, I take it.

40.speaker: Valmorba
40.text: I'm grateful that the people in my garden can rest in peace, but I wish there'd been another way. There's been so much death already.
40.context: NodeContext: Weary on "there's been so much death already"

37.speaker: Valmorba
37.text: And now I have to look up kobold burial rituals.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Do you know there are kobolds looting your graves?

72.speaker: Valmorba
72.text: It is hard to miss, but what can I do? The Watch is too busy to help and I will not fight these thieves.

43.speaker: Valmorba
43.text: Let them have their baubles if they must. That the bones are left to rest is what matters to me.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I need to borrow a shovel, actually.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: There's some strange things happening in this graveyard.

55.speaker: Valmorba
55.text: I deal with the dead, but the Mortarch tends to them, and the living who mourn them.
55.context: NodeContext: busy, doesn't reall have time for this, trying to be polite

65.speaker: Valmorba
65.text: If you have any concerns about 'strange' goings on, kindly speak to her - she patrols the graveyard. Good day.

31.speaker: Valmorba
31.text: You steal from those resting in my garden and still expect an audience? Get out.
31.context: InternalNodeContext: |Needs a "Did a grave robbing" flag - remove 'IMPOSSIBLE' flag once that's in|

64.speaker: Valmorba
64.text: Leave me be. You are not welcome in this place.

75.speaker: Valmorba
75.text: I am sorry for your loss, but - oh, you're back?
75.context: NodeContext: Repeating her line from earlier ("I am sorry for your loss, but it will be a tenday before I can take your departed") when she realises she's met the player before

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I took care of those grave-robbing kobolds for you.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I hear there's a serial killer out there.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Yes, I just need to borrow a shovel.
